title: N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 21 ยง 9001.6 - Appeal
content:
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 21 ยง 9001.6 - Appeal

State Regulations
(a) Any person
denied access to a record or denied a request to amend or correct a record of
personal information will be informed of the right to appeal within 30 days of
such denial, to the President of Battery Park City Authority, pursuant to
section
9000.3
(a) of this

Title (freedom of information regulations) and will be informed of the right to
seek judicial review of appeal determination pursuant to article 78 of the

Civil Practice Law and Rules. Failure to respond to appeal within 10 business
days of receipt of appeal may be construed as a denial. (b) Personal information corrected or
amended, on appeal, will be provided to any person or governmental unit to
which the record or personal information has been or is disclosed pursuant to

Public Officers Law, section 96(1)(d), (i) or (l). (c) All appeals, determinations and reasons
therefor shall be immediately forwarded to the Committee on Open

Government. Notes
N.Y. Comp. Codes
R. & Regs. Tit. 21
ยง
9001.6

State regulations are updated quarterly; we currently have two versions available. Below is a
comparison between our most recent version and the prior quarterly release. More comparison features will be added as we have more versions to compare. No prior version found.
